text:
Hi, I've got a couple more issues.
```fig, ax, plotobject = lines(-60:0.1:800, LACT_rel,
                        color = :red,
                        linewidth = 2, alpha = 0.1)
plotobject.alpha = 0.1```
Both of these methods aren't changing `alpha`.

Also, `limits!`  works, but `ylims!` gives `UndefVarError: ylims! not defined`, despite showing up in the pulldown when typing y.  Same issue with `xlims!` Is there a bug with `y\xlims!`?

text: There is no alpha parameter, but you can set the color to (:red, 0.1)

elements.text: There is no alpha parameter, but you can set the color to (:red, 0.1)

text: Weird with the ylims!, can you try MakieLayout.ylims!? Maybe we have a conflict there or something with an AbstractPlotting and MakieLayout function

elements.text: Weird with the ylims!, can you try MakieLayout.ylims!? Maybe we have a conflict there or something with an AbstractPlotting and MakieLayout function

text: Thanks.  Also, is there a way to turn off the grid lines?

text: you can also theme that if you want it for every axis, like `set_theme(Axis = (xgridvisible = false, ygridvisible = false, ...))`

text: that's odd...one last question for the day...what's the option to change the white space along the borders of the figure?  It seems that the default is to have a lot of extra white space.

elements.text: that's odd...one last question for the day...what's the option to change the white space along the borders of the figure?  It seems that the default is to have a lot of extra white space.

text: ah since the figure switch there is not a super convenient option anymore for that, I should think of something. The default is meant to look good with all other default settings but might be a bit much for smaller plots. So you need to change the `alignmode` of the figure's top layout, which controls this padding. It's by default `Outside(30, 30, 30, 30)`, so 30 units padding on each side. You could set it to  `fig.layout.alignmode = Outside(10, 10, 10, 10)` for example or just `Outside(10)` for short
